Exhibit 99.3 REVISIONED INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY AGREEMENT

This Intellectual Property Agreement (hereinafter referred to as the "Agreement"), entered into on December 20, 2007, is between VERSO BACKHAUL SOLUTIONS, INC. (hereinafter "Backhaul"), a Georgia corporation, and NMS COMMUNICATIONS CORP. (hereinafter "Buyer"), a Delaware corporation.

Under this Agreement, Buyer shall retain the right to use and exploit the Intellectual Property for its own purposes, with Backhaul granting a non-exclusive, worldwide, royalty-free license for such use. In the event that Buyer elects not to exercise this license, Backhaul reserves the right to commercially exploit the Intellectual Property itself or through third parties. The obligations and warranties set forth herein shall be reciprocal in nature, with each party bearing responsibility for the protection and enforcement of its respective intellectual property rights, unless explicitly stated otherwise.

In addition, Backhaul agrees to indemnify Buyer against any claims arising from a breach of this Agreement by Backhaul or its affiliates, except where such claims result from Buyer's negligence, wilful misconduct, or violation of any applicable laws or regulations. This provision shall survive the termination of this Agreement.

Lastly, the parties acknowledge that they have had the opportunity to consult legal counsel prior to entering into this Agreement and understand its terms and consequences. Any disputes arising under this Agreement shall be resolved through binding arbitration in accordance with the rules of the American Arbitration Association.

Understanding Regarding Compensation:

The Service Provider acknowledges that, in return for providing the services as described herein, the Client shall remunerate the Service Provider according to the terms outlined below, with payments due on or after the specified due dates.

/s/ Susanne G. Davis (SEAL) Susanne G. Davis Notary Public, Cobb County, GA My Commission expires Aug. 10, 2010. It is understood that any amendments, modifications, or additions to SCHEDULE A and SCHEDULE B shall be made only upon the mutual written agreement of both parties, unless otherwise specified in this Agreement.

In this revised clause, the obligation for making changes to Schedule A and Schedule B has been shifted from either party to both parties, thereby weakening the ability of one party to unilaterally make such changes. This change ensures a more collaborative approach when modifying the agreements.
